body_html:
Hi @SsnL, I've been working on this, feel like I have most of the forward function moved over the C++, but I had a question about this line:

output = input.new(input.size()[:(ctx.l_diff)] + new_dim).fill_(ctx.value)

I can't seem to track down the C++ equivalent of the .new method being called here. Any suggestions on how I should translate that?
body_text:
Hi @SsnL, I've been working on this, feel like I have most of the forward function moved over the C++, but I had a question about this line:
output = input.new(input.size()[:(ctx.l_diff)] + new_dim).fill_(ctx.value)

I can't seem to track down the C++ equivalent of the .new method being called here. Any suggestions on how I should translate that?
body:
Hi @SsnL, I've been working on this, feel like I have most of the `forward` function moved over the C++, but I had a question about this line:
```
output = input.new(input.size()[:(ctx.l_diff)] + new_dim).fill_(ctx.value)
```

I can't seem to track down the C++ equivalent of the `.new` method being called here. Any suggestions on how I should translate that?
